bioAsHtml: Mani Sarkar is a passionate Java/JVM developer currently living & working in London, an LJC Associate, & an LJC Advocate to the @adoptopenjdk & @adoptajsr programs, JCP Member, OpenJDK contributor, speaker, blogger. Long contributor to the Adopt OpenJDK & sister projects like Betterrev. He sees himself working in areas of core Java, JVM, JDK, Hotspot, Nashorn & Performance Tuning. In his free time works on open-source projects like RESTful APIs, others can be found on his github & bitbucket accounts. He is also an advocate of software craftsmanship principles & practices, XP practices like pair-programming. Fervent user of SonarQube, analysing code quality on a regular basis. A regular at many talks, conferences, etc...

acceptedTalks.title: Why should I contribute to OpenJDK?
